title: Man Carjacked At Knifepoint After Stopping To Help Car Crash In Sydney’s M5 Tunnel
text:
Police are looking for five men after a shocking incident in Sydney’s M5 tunnel at 12.30am on Saturday.

Footage of the ordeal depicts the men crashing their car into another vehicle before carjacking a driver who stopped to help them at knifepoint.

After speeding into a Range Rover in the M5, the Madza crashed into the side of the tunnel before flipping upside down.

A nice driver, obviously concerned for their safety, pulled over to help them. But unfortunately the driver got a little more than he bargained for when the five men exited the vehicle, pulled a knife on the driver and his passenger before stealing their car.

The car hasn’t been found, and the alleged attackers are still on the run from police. The black Honda Accord has the NSW license plate ‘EDB35X’.

Anyone who sees the vehicle has been advised not to approach the drivers as they are likely to be dangerous.

A 19-year-old woman who was driving the Range Rover was taken to hospital with non-life threatening injuries.
description: Police are looking for five men who crashed a car and allegedly carjacked a man at knifepoint after he stopped to help them.
